pyqgis_plugin.description: Import Raster to PgRaster
pyqgis_plugin.about:
The plugin is designed to easily import file-based rasters into a PostGIS database.
The underlying raster import is based on the work of:
- Mateusz Loskot <mateusz@loskot.net> Copyright (C) 2009-2010 - Pierre Racine <pierre.racine@sbf.ulaval.ca> Copyright (C) 2009-2011 - Jorge Arevalo <jorge.arevalo@deimos-space.com> Copyright (C) 2009-2010 - Horst Duester <horst.duester@sourcepole.ch> Copyright (C) 2016

pyqgis_plugin.name: Terra Antiqua
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin creates digital elevation models of paleogeographic maps.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Terra Antiqua deals with the reconstruction of paleogeography, simplifying the reconstruction process. The conceptual approach we follow consists of modifying present-day topography, assuming that it is possible to infer the paleogeography based on present-day observations (e.g., fossil data, thermochronological data). Terra Antiqua provides a complete set of tools to edit Digital Elevation Models (DEM) for paleoreconstructions.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ISO 19157
pyqgis_plugin.description: Application of the ISO 19157 standard on the BTN25 of the CNIG (Aplicación de la norma ISO 19157 sobre la BTN25 del CNIG)

pyqgis_plugin.name: Mapflow
pyqgis_plugin.description: Extract real-world objects from satellite imagery with Mapflow by Geoalert. Mapflow provides AI mapping pipelines for building footprints, roads, fields, forest and construction sites.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Mapflow provides AI models for automatic feature extraction from satellite imagery. Choose a web imagery provider or upload you own image, select what type of features you want to extract and your area of interest, and Mapflow will do the rest. Currently, we can extract: - buildings - agricultural fields - forest (optionally, with height) - roads - construction sites For a step-by-step user guide, go to https://docs.mapflow.ai/api/qgis_mapflow#user-interface
pyqgis_plugin.tags: digitizing,classification,remote sensing,roads,feature extraction,forest,satellite,forestry,machine learning,earth observation,deep learning,artificial intelligence,construction detection,building detection,agricultural field detection

pyqgis_plugin.name: PrecisionCursor
pyqgis_plugin.description: Gives you a button to switch the mouse cursor to a high precision pointer
pyqgis_plugin.about: Especially useful where standard map tools give you only imprecise cursors with unclear hotspot, like the "open hand" cursor for panning. Now with a set of extra large ruler / guideline cursors.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Generate SWMM inp
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate SWMM input files from layers and import input files from SWMM to QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin provides tools to generate SWMM input files from layers in QGIS, and to import SWMM input files into QGIS. You can create submodels above or below a certain node in your model layers. The plugin needs the python library 'pandas' which should be included in current QGIS versions. If it is not already installed, it can be added in a advanced QGIS installation or via pip. Instructions and a documentation can be found on the plugin´s GIT (see link "homepage" below).
Cite as: Schilling, J.; Tränckner, J. Generate_SWMM_inp: An Open-Source QGIS Plugin to Import and Export Model Input Files for SWMM. Water 2022, 14, 2262. https://doi.org/10.3390/w14142262
First versions of this plugin have been developed within the project PROSPER-RO, funded by BMBF, grant number 033L212.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Greek Data

pyqgis_plugin.about: Easy and quick access to open geospatial data for Greece. Refer <a href="https://www.elymperis.com/greekdata-qgis">here</a> for more information. Originally developed for <a href="https://www.geomeletitiki.gr">Geomeletitiki Consulting Engineers</a> by <a href="https://gr.linkedin.com/in/efstathios-lymperis-975702188">Efstathios Lymperis</a>, Geoscientist & Geospatial Software Engineer.<br /> <br /> Version 2.0 is a complete re-write and features a new interface, along with some other features. You can read more <a href="https://www.elymperis.com/greekdata-qgis">here</a>. The main change, is that fetched layers are now cached in a local settings.json file, so that they can be searched through and accessed easily. They then get updated every 7 days. Since the change is quite significant, the version has been bumped to 2.0.0, and your feedback is more than welcome.

pyqgis_plugin.name: PCRaster Tools
pyqgis_plugin.description: Processing provider for PCRaster operations
pyqgis_plugin.about: PCRaster is a powerful package of software for map algebra and environmental dynamic modelling. The main applications of PCRaster are found in environmental modelling: geography, hydrology, ecology to name a few. An extensive set of operators is available: several point operators (analytical and arithmetical functions, Boolean operators, operators for relations, comparison, rounding, field generation etc.), neighbourhood operators for calculations in moving windows (highpass filtering, edge filtering, moving averages, etc.), area operators for calculations within specified areas (for instance soil groups), operators for the calculation of cost paths. In the PCRaster package a rich suite of geomorphological and hydrological functions is available. These include functions for visibility analysis, catchment analysis and routing of transport (drainage) of material in a catchment using interactively generated local drain direction maps and transport (routing) operations. These operations are made available in the QGIS Processing Toolbox through this plugin.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Hans van der Kwast, North Road

pyqgis_plugin.name: Vertical Photo Placer

pyqgis_plugin.name: totalopenstationToQgis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Total Station Luncher in a connector for Total Open Station (TOPS for friends) and it is a free software program for downloading and processing data from total station devices. This one is a plugin to connect with totalopenstation software developed as part of the IOSA project by Stefano Costa and Luca Bianconi, archaeologists and Damien Gaignon() .
pyqgis_plugin.about: Total Open Station (TOPS for friends) is a free software program for downloading and processing data from total station devices. This is a task which is usually done by proprietary, dedicated and Windows™-only software, but TOPS is different by nature, because: it is free software released under the GNU GPLv3 license; it works on any operating system; it is designed to support as many devices and formats as possible, all within the same program, opposed to having one program per device. Every model has its own quirks, but TOPS uses a modular structure and keeps the downloading of data logically separated from its processing, thus enabling exporting data to a variety of output formats, even at a later moment. Archiving of raw data is made easy by using plain text files. Users of Total Open Station are a growing number, you can be the next. See which Models are already supported.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Enzo Cocca , Stefano Costa & Damien Gaignon

pyqgis_plugin.name: Morfofrac
pyqgis_plugin.description: Get the fractal dimension
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This program allows to apply the box counting technique to estimate the fractal dimension of a polygonal figure of one or more pieces, contained in the file on which the process will be run. The program returns 6 shapes with their respective mandatory files (shp, shx, dbf). The first shape contains the minimum square box that contains the analyzed figure. We call this level, N0. Subsequently, another five files are generated, the first of these (N1) divides the box of the first file into four equal squares. The next one (N2), a mosaic of 16 (4x4) squares, each one half the length of the previous ones, that fit inside these, and so on. After generating the files, the program delivers a list that indicates the number of squares in each file, and the number of occupied squares of each dimension inside the figure. You can estimate outside the QGIS program, the regression line whose slope is the dimension fractal. The largest square is l long. The second half of l, the third l / 2/2 and so on.
This complement was developed under the supervision of Dr. Luis Chías from GITS, Institute of Geography- UNAM. On whose page you can find more detailed information.

pyqgis_plugin.about: The water accounting and productivity plugin for QGIS platform provides access to all the WaPOR data and includes it in the QGIS canvas as another raster layer, providing WaPOR data easy access to the QGIS users. Moreover, the water accounting and productivity component of the plugin will help the water management, providing the opportunity of calculating water accounting indicators, through the creation of maps and reports.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Speckle
pyqgis_plugin.description: Speckle 2.0 Connector for QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about:
The Speckle QGIS plugin allows you send and receive data from multiple sources to/from several layers in your project, and store their geometry (as well as their contained metadata), in a Speckle server.
Don't know what Speckle is? You're not alone! Find out more at https://speckle.systems You can start exploring by checking out this commit generated in QGIS from open web data sources (OSM, Google Satellite Tiles and Mapzen Terrain Tiles): https://speckle.xyz/streams/5feae56049/commits/b5f4cc5f3b
Requirements: - Speckle Manager: You can download the installer here -> https://speckle.guide/user/manager - An account in a Speckle server. If you don't have one, feel free to use our public server https://speckle.xyz - An account added in the Accounts section of the Speckle Manager - Windows and Mac compatible
If the requirements are not fullfilled, the plugin will load but will not have any functionality enabled.
If you're having issues with this plugin, you can always reach us at https://speckle.community
Plugin is using the external libraries such as pyshp, scipy, triangle and specklepy, which will be installed automatically to a custom folder.
Data types currently not supported for sending: - Layers depending on the server connection (WMS, WFC, WCS etc.) - Scenes - Mesh Vector layers - Pointclouds

pyqgis_plugin.name: AutoLayoutTool
pyqgis_plugin.description: One-click print layout creator
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin creates in one click a layout based on the extent of a QGIS project main window. It also adds a legend, a scale bar and a north arrow to the layout. The size of the map is calculated to occupy the maximum space on the page and the orientation of the page is determined by the extent of the map.
Ce plugin crée en un clic une mise en page basée sur l'étendue de la fenêtre principale d'un projet QGIS. Il ajoute également une légende, une barre d'échelle et une flèche du nord à la mise en page. La taille de la carte est calculée pour occuper l'espace maximum sur la page et l'orientation de la page est déterminée par l'étendue de la carte.

(2021). QHadoop Tools. QGIS 3 plugin version 0.1.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Mobility Areas
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin build dynamic mobility areas based on origin destination data
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin build dynamic mobility areas based on origin destination data

pyqgis_plugin.name: Magnetic Bearing Measurement Map Tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Measure magnetic bearing and distance between two points
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin adds a new map tool to the QGIS interactive measurements toolbox and to the measurements menu (View → Measure → Measure Magnetic Bearing).
* Toggle between geodetic (° T) and magnetic (° M) bearings. * View declination at start point and model error estimation. * Uses the WMM2020 model, valid for dates in the range 2020.0 to 2025.0. * Temporal controller aware: uses the beginning of the current timeframe if the controller is active; otherwise it uses current time as the reference epoch.

pyqgis_plugin.name: AMIL-Assistente de Mapa Interativo Leaflet
pyqgis_plugin.description: Um assistente para criar mapas interativos no navegador utilizando Leaflet
pyqgis_plugin.about: Cria mapas interativos que podem ser abertos no navegador através das camadas vetoriais disponíveis. É possivel alterar cores e traços da simbologia, rótulos de atributos. Ao final do processamento, o complemento gerará uma pasta com os arquivos necessários para exibição em qualquer navegador.

pyqgis_plugin.name: CalcArea2
pyqgis_plugin.description: Show layer area and length when editing.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Merge Selected Features (Processing)
pyqgis_plugin.description: Merge selected features in a polygon vector layer
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows you to merge selected features in a polygon vector layer. QGis already has a menu tool for this purpose, but this plugin performs the operation much faster, especially when the number of selected features is in the order of hundreds or thousands. Note: merging only takes place when there are two or more selected features. To run the plugin, go to Processing Toolbox -> Merge Selected Features -> Merge Selected Features Vers 0.1

pyqgis_plugin.name: QGIS Report wizard
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS templating engine for odt and hypertext documents
pyqgis_plugin.about: A plugin for odt and plain text reports generation. The plugin makes use of python templating libraries (jinja2, secretary) for creating reports from data (variables, layers, features, layouts and other global settings) within the current QGIS project in ODT format or other text/hypertext format. More info on repository home page: https://github.com/enricofer/qgis_report_wizard

pyqgis_plugin.name: Gazetteer Berlin/Brandenburg
pyqgis_plugin.description: A plug-in to search for addresses in Berlin/Brandenburg and cadastral data of Brandenburg
pyqgis_plugin.about: The results can be viewed on the map as geometry. The plug-in uses official and daily updated data (https://search.geobasis-bb.de/) from the State Office for Land Surveying and Geoinformation Brandenburg (LGB).

pyqgis_plugin.name: QGIS GeoNode
pyqgis_plugin.description: A QGIS plugin for integrating with modern GeoNode
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin adds GeoNode client functionality to QGIS - search, load and manage GeoNode resources from inside QGIS.
Initial development has been commissioned by the by the Pacific Community (SPC), with funcding from the World Bank, and implemented by the Kartoza and GeoSolutions teams. The plugin is actively maintained and aims to keep up to date with changes in the GeoNode API.
Check the website for a user guide and more detail.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ICEtool
pyqgis_plugin.description: Estimation of urban heat island
pyqgis_plugin.about: Easy but real physical estimation of ground temperatures to help treat urban heat islands and create better urban designs. ICEtool allows you to make and highlight the urban design choices (e.g. vegetation, materials) that reduce urban heat island phenomena. ICEtool includes UMEP shadow generator, thanks to all UMEP plugin contributors for all their work! To get started with ICEtool, check that QGIS Processing Toolbox is displayed (CTRL+ALT+T) and read the user manual in the Help menu.

pyqgis_plugin.name: STAC API Browser
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS plugin for reading STAC API catalogs
pyqgis_plugin.about: Adds functionality to search, load and manage STAC API resources inside QGIS. Sponsored by Microsoft.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GeoEASIN
pyqgis_plugin.description: Web services downloader and tools to analyze the European Alien Species Information Network data (EASIN).
pyqgis_plugin.about: Data downloader from <a href="https://easin.jrc.ec.europa.eu/easin/Services/RestfulWebService">EASIN Geospatial Web Service</a>
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Patricio Soriano (Geoinnova, python development), Roberto Matellanes (GIS&Beers, processing tools)

pyqgis_plugin.name: DataGrandEst
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin pour QGIS 3 fournissant un accès simple aux flux de géographiques WMS et WFS de DataGrandEst et d'autres ressources géographiques utiles en région Grand Est.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin for QGIS 3 providing simple access to WMS and WFS geographic flows from DataGrandEst and other useful geographic resources in the Grand Est region.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Région Hauts-de-France, Neogeo Technologies, Benjamin Chartier, UMR LETG

pyqgis_plugin.name: QMapshaper
pyqgis_plugin.description: This allows running mapshaper tool (need to be locally installed) as a processing tool or using interactive GUI tool.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This allows running mapshaper tool (need to be locally installed) as a processing tool or using interactive GUI tool.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Flurstücksfinder NRW
pyqgis_plugin.description: Find and display parcels (German State of North Rhine-Westphalia) - Flurstücksuche in NRW
pyqgis_plugin.about:
Remark: The plugin uses data which covers only NRW/Germany. That's why the plugin is only available in German language.
Dieses Plugin bietet die Möglichkeit, Flurstücke innerhalb von Nordrhein-Westfalen zu finden. Datengrundlage sind „WFS NW ALKIS Vereinfacht“ von Geobasis NRW und die KRZN-WFS "ALKIS Vereinfacht".

pyqgis_plugin.name: OpenTopography DEM Downloader
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin downloads DEM from OpenTopography.org
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin will download DEMs from OpenTopography.org for user selected extent only
DEMs: 1. SRTM 90m 2. SRTM 30m 3. ALOS World 3D 30m 4. SRTM GL1 Ellipsoidal 30m 5. Global Bathymetry SRTM15+ V2.1 6. Copernicus Global DSM 30m 7. Copernicus Global DSM 90m 8. NASADEM Global DEM 9. Europe DTM 30m 10. GEDI L3 Grid 1km
** Get an API Key from OpenTopography.org to download the DEMs

pyqgis_plugin.name: Raster Divider
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin divides raster into equal sized parts.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin divides raster into equal sized chunks depend on desired size.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Cluster Analysis
pyqgis_plugin.description: Perform attribute based clustering on vector layers
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows to perform attribute based clustering (Agglomerative Hierarchical and K-Means) on vector layers, with functions for feature selection and clustering evaluation. The plugin requires the libraries scikit_learn, numpy, and pandas (see the repository for installation guide and other documentaion)

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layout Panel
pyqgis_plugin.description: Add a panel to manage layouts directly from QGIS main window
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin adds a new panel to manage print layouts directly from QGIS main window. It allows to quickly open, create, rename, delete and filter print layouts without having to open the layout manager. It supports layout templates and also makes it possible to batch export one or multiple layouts to PDF, Image or SVG formats without having to open each print layout.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Cadastral Classifier
pyqgis_plugin.description: <p><p>Clasificación parcelaria de municipios españoles utilizando información catastral<p><p>Parcel classification of Spanish municipalities using cadastral information
pyqgis_plugin.about: <p><p>Cadastral Classifier is a plugin to classify urban parcels of any Spanish municipality (excluding Navarra and País Vasco) using cadastral information (obtainable via official channels)<p><p>Clasificador Catastral es un complemento para la clasificación del parcelario de cualquier municipio español (excluyendo Navarra y País Vasco) utilizando la información de la Dirección General del Catastro

pyqgis_plugin.name: Floodplain Inundation Calculator
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin calculates inundation durations in floodplains.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The frequency and duration of inundations in floodplains is of great interest as it affects habitat provision and biodiversity as well as various biogeochemical soil processes maintaining water quality. The development of the Inundation Calculator is intended to enable a simple approximation of yearly average flooding durations in floodplains by using river water levels and the floodplain topography. We are often confronted with the problem that no spatially and/or temporally high-resolution remote sensing data or open source 3D flooding model are available. So we need to find easy solutions which can be applied by everyone, although these remain rough approximations and users must be aware of application limitations.

pyqgis_plugin.name: PrgDig
pyqgis_plugin.description: Land usage digital planning validation system for Provincia Autonoma di Trento - Servizio Urbanistica
pyqgis_plugin.about: Automatic validation of land usage digital planning. Only needed if you are designing land digital planning for Provincia Autonoma di Trento - Servizio Urbanistica

pyqgis_plugin.name: GeoPortal.rlp Metadata Search
pyqgis_plugin.description: GeoPortal.rlp metadata search module
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin uses the REST search interface of GeoPortal.rlp for searching spatial datasets and services. It has also an option to search in remote CSW-based catalogues (e.g. in the INSPIRE Geoportal Catalogue and the german Geodatenkatalog.DE). WMS/WFS and OGC API Features interfaces can direct be loaded into the QGIS Browser.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Noise Prediction
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin estimates the noisel level by distances and barriers as BS:5228 standard.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Noise Estimation From Point Source Algorithm British Standard - BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014 Factors For consideration 1) the sound power outputs of processes and plant; 2) the periods of operation of processes and plant; 3) the distances from sources to receiver; 4) the presence of screening by barriers; 5) the reflection of sound; 6) soft ground attenuation. Other factors such as meteorological conditions (particularly wind speed and direction) and atmospheric absorption can also influence the level of noise received. The estimation of the effects of these factors is complicated, not least because of interaction between these factors, and is beyond the scope of this standard.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Dissolve Adjacent Polygons
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin dissolves polygons adjacent to other polygons, according to user-chosen options.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin dissolves polygons whose area falls below a user-defined threshold. The dissolution is carried out into adjacent polygons of larger or smaller area, according to the option chosen by the user. The user can also choose an adjacency by common largest border.To run the plugin once installed, go to Processing Toolbox -> Dissolve Adjacent Polygons.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Import .3d file
pyqgis_plugin.description: Import features from survex .3d files
pyqgis_plugin.about: Import features into vector layers from a survex .3d file.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Convert Heights
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin allows to calculate EGM96 and EGM2008 elevations in Poland based on KRON86 or EVRF2007 normal heights.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows to calculate EGM96 and EGM2008 elevations in Poland based on KRON86 or EVRF2007 normal heights. Created for the needs of civil aviation.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Encoded Polyline
pyqgis_plugin.description: Load encoded polyline into QGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Polyline encoding is a lossy compression algorithm that allows you to store a series of coordinates as a single string. This plugin helps you to load and visualize an encoded polyline on QGIS.

pyqgis_plugin.name: SIGPAC Downloader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin to download SIGPAC parcels
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Agricultural Plot Geographic Information System (SIGPAC) enables the geographic identification of plots declared by farmers and livestock farmers in Spain. This plugin allows the user to easily download the plots of every municipality. Prior to that, the Terms&Conditions of the web page must be accepted and a download directory must be selected. The SIGPAC Downloader uses the ATOM service according to the Inspire Directive. It was promoted by Fundación CETEMAS in order to facilitate a practical tool to multiple potential users from forest and agricultural sector.<br>Video tutorial: <a href='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=98nwmIAHLmQ'>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=98nwmIAHLmQ</a>

pyqgis_plugin.name: Tree Belt Designer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Design tree and shrub belts
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin provides knowledge for design the future tree belt network in terms of the estimation of potential insolation within agricultural landscape. The design process bases on the user library containing attributes of tree and shrub species. The process is also supported by the soil type data, the parcel-based layout, and the digital surface model (DSM). The outcome provides the modified DSM extended with user’s tree belt project. Based on the modified DSM, the potential insolation and contrary to insolation - the shading effect caused by tree belt network is possible to estimate using plugins of different GIS software. Moreover, the outcome allows to estimate the insolation/shading effect within another arrangement of tree and shrub groups or single individuals planned by the user in his project.<br><br>Icons from https://www.flaticon.com/authors/dinosoftlabs
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Jakub Skowroński, Maciej Nowak, Jakub Nowosad

pyqgis_plugin.name: Modzy
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin provides seamless access to Modzy's ML, DL and AI models. Please be sure to install the Modzy SDK to QGIS: - Mac OS X: In a terminal, execute: /Applications/QGIS.app/Contents/MacOS/bin/python3 -m pip install modzy-sdk - Windows: In a terminal, execute: C:\OSGeo4W\apps\Python39>pip install modzy-sdk To see more documentation, please view this page on Modzy's official documentation site.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Modzy hosts a public marketplace of ML, AI algorithms for use as well as a private library for subscribers. This plugin provides seamless access to Modzy's ML, DL and AI models. Please be sure to install the Modzy SDK to QGIS: - Mac OS X: In a terminal, execute: /Applications/QGIS.app/Contents/MacOS/bin/python3 -m pip install modzy-sdk - Windows: In a terminal, execute: C:\OSGeo4W\apps\Python39>pip install modzy-sdk+ To see more documentation, please view this page on Modzy's official documentation site.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Geographical detector
pyqgis_plugin.description: A tool for measuring spatial stratified heterogeneity and spatial associations of geographical attributes
pyqgis_plugin.about: Spatial Stratified Heterogeneity (SSH) refers to the phenomena that the within strata are more similar than the between strata.Examples are land-use types and climate zones in spatial data. Geographical detector is a statistical tool to measure SSH and to make attribution for/by SSH; (1) measure and find SSH among data; (2) test the coupling between two variables Y and X and (3) investigate interaction between two explanatory variables X1 and X2 to a response variable Y.

pyqgis_plugin.name: TerraHidro
pyqgis_plugin.description: The TerraHidro plugin provides an interface for the TerraHidro console used in hydrological applications.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The TerraHidro plugin provides an interface for the TerraHidro console used in hydrological applications.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Spatial Analysis Toolbox
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin adds some useful algorithms for Spatial Analysis.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin adds some useful algorithms for Spatial Analysis. Some of them are: Moran's I, Local Moran's I, GWR. Dependencies: pandas, geopandas, libpysal, esda, mgwr.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Testada de Lotes
pyqgis_plugin.description: Batch Tested Extraction
pyqgis_plugin.about: The batch tested plugin will generate a new layer, in which it will extract the batch tested line from the polygonal layer, the generated shape will bring the native attributes of the source layer, in addition to adding a new field with the size of each test. (O plugin testada de lote irá gerar uma nova camada, na qual ele irá extrair a linha da testada do lote a partir da camada poligonal, o shape gerado irá trazer os atributos nativos da camada de origem, além de acrescentar um novo campo com o tamanho de cada testada.)

pyqgis_plugin.name: Dissolve Related
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin allows dissolving only connected objects
pyqgis_plugin.about: Existing QGIS Dissolve functions allow dissolving objects based on shared attribute. As a result you receive a new layer with multipart objects. Dissolve Related plugin dissolves only connected features. Thus, as a result you receive a layer, where only connected features are dissolved. The rest of features are intact - even if they share attribute values.</br>There is also a dedicated to arc geometry function (keep arcs singlepart checkbox), which dissolves only arcs that are connected to up to two other arcs, related by common first or last node. It creates dissolved singlepart arcs. Multipart to singlepart QGIS function will not divide such objects to their previous state.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GeoStrategieKit
pyqgis_plugin.description: GeoStrategieKit is een plugin waarin verschillende analyses van StraTopo toegankelijk zijn gemaakt waaronder het maken van isochronen.
pyqgis_plugin.about: GeoStrategieKit is een plugin waarin verschillende analyses van StraTopo toegankelijk zijn gemaakt waaronder het maken van isochronen.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Palapa
pyqgis_plugin.description: Upload, editing and delete spatial data or metadata from geoportal Palapa
pyqgis_plugin.about: Upload, editing and delete spatial data or metadata from geoportal Palapa
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Sandy Setyanagara, Ahmad Nur Aly, Moh Mahrus Ali

pyqgis_plugin.name: Wody Polskie - Baza WMS
pyqgis_plugin.description: Baza usług WMS publikowanych przez Państwowe Gospodarstwo Wodne Wody Polskie
pyqgis_plugin.about: Wtyczka Wody Polskie - Baza WMS umożliwia szybki dostęp do usług sieciowych publikowanych przez Państwowe Gospodarstwo Wodne Wody Polskie (32 usług). Dodatkowo wtyczka umożliwia pobieranie wybranych danych przestrzennych. Publikowane usługi dla: Mapa Podziału Hydrograficznego Polski w skali 1:10000 (MPHP10k), Plany Gospodarowania Wodami (PGW), Jednostki organizacyjne PGW Wody Polskie, Wstępna ocena ryzyka powodziowego (WORP), Mapy zagrożenia powodziowego (MZP), Mapy ryzyka powodziowego (MRP), Plany zarządzania ryzykiem powodziowym (PZRP), Plan przeciwdziałania skutkom suszy (PPSS).Zasięg przestrzenny: Polska. ENG: This plugin allows quick access to web map services published by the State Water Holding Polish Waters (32 services) and download selected spatial data. Spatial coverage: Poland.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Łukasz Ścisłowski - Państwowe Gospodarstwo Wodne Wody Polskie - KZGW - Wydział SIGW

pyqgis_plugin.name: Peel Orange Scale Distortion Visualizer
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin visualizes the scale distortion for a given region
pyqgis_plugin.about: OrangePeel is a plugin that visualizes the scale distortion on a given region on a given projection. This tool algorithmically creates a grid of points over a given region and calculates the scale factor at each of these points. The points are then used in making a gradient map that visualize the gradient of change in scale distortion over that region.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Buffer Without Overlaps
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin creates a buffer around features of given type, without overlaps.
pyqgis_plugin.about: A new field named "Area" is created and updated in the result layer named "Buffer.shp". The "Input vector field" should preferably be a sequentially numbered Id reference field.The user can use several options to adapt End Caps and Join Styles to her/his needs. Please download and read the Manual, available from homepage. To run the plugin, go to Processing Toolbox and click on Buffer Without Overlaps. To use the "buffer_without_overlaps" plugin, you need to install and enable the "Processing Saga NextGen Provider" plugin, along with the latest SAGA GIS version (9.x): 1 - download the latest version 9.x of SAGA GIS; 2 - unzip the file "saga-9.3.2_x64" or newer and look for the file "saga4qgis"; unzip this file and follow the instructions contained therein; 3 - activate the "Processing Saga NextGen Provider" plugin by going to Settings->Options->Processing->Providers->SAGANG and enable SAGA, and look for the folder where "saga-9.3.2_x64" was unzipped (this folder must be kept).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Tile Network Order
pyqgis_plugin.description: Tile Network Order plugin generates Ordering ID, Burying Depths, Flow Direction etc.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The Tile Network Order plugin generates Ordering ID, Burying Depths, Flow Direction etc.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Illini Drainage Tools
pyqgis_plugin.description: Performs Specific Draiange Related Tasks and Analysis on a Site using a LiDAR DEM data.

pyqgis_plugin.name: OSM SidewalKreator
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin designated to create the Geometries of Sidewalks (separated from streets) based on OpenStreetMap Streets, given a bounding polygon, outputting to a .geojson to be imported on JOSM. It is mostly intended for accessibility Mapping.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin designated to create the Geometries of Sidewalks (separated from streets) based on OpenStreetMap Streets, given a bounding polygon, outputting a .geojson that should be imported on JOSM to update OSM data. It is mostly intended for accessibility Mapping.

pyqgis_plugin.name: S.P.A.N.N.E.R.S.
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin for creation, visualization, modification and analysis of graphs
pyqgis_plugin.about:
The S.P.A.N.N.E.R.S. plugin provides the creation, visualization and modification of graphs from geographical information.
In addition, this QGIS plugin serves as a frontend for the backend that supports the execution of analyses on the created graphs. For the execution of these analyses, the backend is required. The backend receives graph information from the frontend over the network in order to execute analyses on it using the Open Graph Drawing Framework (see https://ogdf.uos.de/).
Furthermore, customisable experiments can be performed and the results can automatically be visualised in a scientific manner.
Probably, the following python package needs to be installed: protobuf(>=3.17). Detailed installation instructions for the frontend and the backend are provided in the handbook (see https://project2.informatik.uni-osnabrueck.de/spanners/). The handbook also contains detailed usage information.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Theoretical Computer Science Group, Osnabrück University: Dennis Benz, Timo Glane, Tim Hartmann, Benedikte Lechtermann, Steffen Meinert, Levin Nemesch, Leon Nienhüser, Leon Richardt, Jo Sandor, Joshua Sangmeister, Maria Stjepic, Julian Pascal Wittker

pyqgis_plugin.name: What3words Tools
pyqgis_plugin.description: Enables what3words addresses in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: <p>what3words is a global grid of 57 trillion 3mx3m squares. Each square has a 3 word address that can be communicated quickly, easily and with no ambiguity. Our geocoder turns geographic coordinates into 3 word addresses and vice-versa. Our plugin lets you work with the addresses within QGIS.</p><p>To get started please <a href="https://accounts.what3words.com/" target="_blank">create an account with what3words</a>, select your free tier and get your free API key.</p>

pyqgis_plugin.name: Clear Null Geometry
pyqgis_plugin.description: Clear Null Geometry is a QGIS Plugin which is use to remove all Null geometries from selected layers.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin deletes all NULL geometry from the shapefile. New users of QGIS easily creates NULL geometry to shapefiles when they trying to delete a geometry and facing difficulties to delete all of them easily, this plugin will help them to delete all NULL geometry from all selected layers. Steps to Use it: 1. At first Install this plugins and check it available. 2. Select all opened vector layers (which one has null geometries) from 'Layer' panel. *Note: It can work on multiple Layer in single time. Select all Layers which has null geometries. 3. Click on the tool from toolbar or select Vector menu --> Clear Null Geometry --> Clear Null Geometry. * Please give a vote (stars) according to your experiences, it will motivate me. If you required any other tools or plugins please contact with me "mastools.help@gmail.com".

pyqgis_plugin.name: Civil Engineering Tools Provider
pyqgis_plugin.description: Tools to automate the early design of civil engineering projects. This is a Provider with three tools: Reservoir, Earthworks and LRS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Reservoir creates a basic dam design and calculates the related flooding area. Earthworks create the cut & fill earthwork for a platform area. LRS creates marks and text for linear referencing system of polylines.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GeoINCRA
pyqgis_plugin.description: Georreferenciamento de Imóveis Rurais
pyqgis_plugin.about: Ferramentas para georreferenciamento de imóveis rurais conforme normas técnicas do Instituto Nacional de Colonização e Reforma Agrária (INCRA).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Smooth Geometry Tool
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin smooth the selected geometries
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin smooths the selected geometries. A configuration dialog permits to change the smoothing settings (iterations, offset, minimumDistance and maxAngle). Suggested default starting configuration: Iterations = 1 Offset = 0.3 MinimumDistance = -1 MaxAngle = 180

pyqgis_plugin.name: DaumAPI
pyqgis_plugin.description: Daum API Tool
pyqgis_plugin.about: This is a Tool for Daum API. You can use this app without license.

pyqgis_plugin.name: WhiteboxTools for QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.description: Advanced geospatial data analysis platform.
pyqgis_plugin.about: WhiteboxTools (WBT) is an advanced geospatial software package and a data analysis platform with functionality in GIS, remote sensing, LiDAR data processing, DEM analysis, spatial hydrology, and stream network analysis. It was developed by Dr. John Lindsay, at the University of Guelph, and co-founder of Whitebox Geospatial Inc. This plugin provides the QGIS interface with WBT, however it does not include the WBT binary itself. Before using the tools, you will need to download and install them from [https://www.whiteboxgeo.com/](https://www.whiteboxgeo.com/). Instructions about how to install this plugin can also be found in the user manual, at [https://www.whiteboxgeo.com/manual/wbt_book/qgis_plugin.html](https://www.whiteboxgeo.com/manual/wbt_book/qgis_plugin.html). For a video demonstrating how to setup the plugin, please see [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xJXDBsNbcTg&t=3s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xJXDBsNbcTg&t=3s).

pyqgis_plugin.name: ALS Downloader
pyqgis_plugin.description: ALS data downloader for Slovenia and the Netherlands.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Download ALS (LiDAR) data. Plugin can be found under Web menu. It provides fishnet and Action for downloading selected grids of following Countries: Slovenia The Netherlands

pyqgis_plugin.name: Importer2OSMbasemap
pyqgis_plugin.description: Import data into a QGIS Project, with OSM basemap
pyqgis_plugin.about: Importer2OSMbasemap create a QGIS Project, with an OSM basemap. It allows to import data (SHP, DXF, geoJSON)

pyqgis_plugin.name: Download Statistics Portugal Open Data
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin enables the open data download of geographical and statistical Information from Statistics Portugal
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin has been developed to allow more accessibility to the information available about Census (1991, 2001, 2011, 2021) small statistical areas and statistical indicators linked to them. This is Open Data available for both public organisms and private companies.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Francisco Caldeira - Instituto Nacional de Estatística
pyqgis_plugin.tags: buildings,population,census,ine,censos 2021,censos,instituto nacional de estatística,base geográfica de georeferenciação da informação,bgri,alojamentos,agregados,small statistical areas,população,households,edifícios

pyqgis_plugin.name: Cronometro
pyqgis_plugin.description: Il plugin crea un semplice cronometro in ambiente QGIS. Il conteggiop del tempo trascorso verrá visualizzato sia nella finestra del plugin the nella barra di stato.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
Un semplice cronometro in ambiente QGIS per valutare la durata delle operazioni, con pulsanti start/stop e reset.
Il tempo trascorso sarà visibile sia in una finestra dedicata del plugin che nella barra di stato. Quando la finestra viene chiusa senza interruzioni e reimpostazioni, il conteggio del tempo trascorso continuerà a essere disponibile nella barra di stato. Per interromperlo riaprire la finestra e selezionare reset.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Mapmaker
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin help you to make map for tactical use.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin contains tools to create a named grid, to make atlas for print map and to make map kml-file to load into Garmin. You can create a chess-notated grid, create a rectangle grid for atlas generation and generate atlas for print. Also you can create kml to load it into Garmin GPS navigator. This plugin include tools to quick switch between "local" coordinate system and EPSG:3857, to insert your logo into printed map and to set distance points along tracks.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Annotation to Label
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin converts the Text annotations on print layout labels. It provides also some buttons to show/hide and remove the Text Annotations.
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin provides some useful tools to work with Text Annotations. A dedicated toolbar will provide some buttons to show/hide or remove the Text Annotations and a tool to convert the canvas map Text Annotations on print layout labels.
The Annotations/labels conversion tool allows defining the name, size and orientation of the new layout that will contain the labels. If the provided name is the same as an existing print layout it will be possible to decide if overwrite the old version.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Smarty
pyqgis_plugin.description: Smarty Geocoding QGIS Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.about: <b>Simple and Accurate Geocoding For Your Maps</b><br><br>Smarty’s QGIS Geocoding plugin allows you to interactively geocode US addresses on your QGIS maps. There are several geocoding plugins in QGIS to choose from, but Smarty's plugin is the easiest to use and the most accurate, with addresses being geocoded down to the rooftop and parcel levels. Subaddress geocodes are also available for secondary addresses such as apartments and suites.<br><br><b>Address Verification, Standardization, and Autocomplete Included</b><br><br>Simply enter an address and let our plugin validate, standardize, geocode, and plot it on your map. It even uses our US Address Autocomplete product to help you avoid entering errant address information.<br><br><b>Batch Geocoding Available</b><br><br>While a subscription is not required to use the plugin, Smarty customers with a US Rooftop Geocoding subscription have the additional benefit of geocoding large batches of addresses at rates of up to 600-700 records/sec.<br><br><ul><li><a href="https://www.smarty.com/docs/qgis-geocoding-plugin-us-address">Read the documentation for this plugin</a></li><li><a href="https://www.smarty.com/plugins/qgis-geocoding-plugin-us-address">Learn more about Smarty's QGIS Geocoding Plugin - US Address</a></li><li><a href="https://www.smarty.com/products/us-rooftop-geocoding#geocoding-tool">Learn more about Smarty's US Rooftop Geocoding</a></li><li><a href="https://www.smarty.com/">Visit Smarty.com</a></li></ul><br><br><b>Additional Metadata Output</b><br><br>Output fields include parsed, standardized address components, ZIP+4 Code, precision match level, county name, FIPS Code, congressional district, time zone with Daylight Savings Indicator, and whether the address is residential or commercial (RDI).<br><br>
pyqgis_plugin.tags: python,geocoding,address,geocode,geocoder,address validation,address correction,address verification,address standardization,address parsing,address matching,time zone,rdi,rooftop,county fips codes,congressional district,daylight savings,residential or commercial

pyqgis_plugin.name: Google Street View Layer
pyqgis_plugin.description: A QGIS plugin that uses your road layer, and creates a layer or table with the most recent Google Street View capture data. Google API Key required!
pyqgis_plugin.about: A QGIS plugin that uses your road layer, and creates a layer or table with the most recent Google Street View capture data. Google API Key required!

pyqgis_plugin.name: H3 Toolkit
pyqgis_plugin.description: Tools for the H3 discrete global grid system.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin adds an H3 processing provider to QGIS, with tools that let users create H3 grids. These tools are powered by the open source H3 library (<a href="https://h3geo.org/">https://h3geo.org/</a>) NOTE: The official H3 Library ('h3' Python package) is not shipped with this plugin and has to be installed separately. The plugin detects if the package is missing and offers basic guidance on how to install.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Space Time Cube
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin creates a space-time cube based on given data.
pyqgis_plugin.about: The main purpose of the plugin is the detection of hot spots (space-time clusters) localised in space and time using two different statistics: Getis-Ord and Local Moran's I. The plugin is composed of four tabs, in which the first one obtains the inputs -a space-time point dataset and the dimensions of the cube. The second and third tabs allows interactive analysis. "Temporal Change" tab allows temporal analysis on a selected cell. "Neighbours" tab allows investigation of the neighbouring cells of a selected cell. Finally, "Simulation" tab allows generation of random space-time point dataset for further analysis. The four outputs of the plugin are as follows: 1. A csv file detailing the chosen statistics values at the cell level. 2. A csv file that providing information for individual points. 3. A shape file that visualises the created cells. 4. The tiff files for each time slice demonstrating the cell's statistics to allow raster analysis. Video tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ibbs7u-iawE

pyqgis_plugin.name: Layer Group and Sort
pyqgis_plugin.description: Group the layers by type and sort them alphanumerically into their own group
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin groups the layers of the project according to their type and reorders them alphanumeric within their own group

pyqgis_plugin.name: Fetch
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate gegraphical fetch
pyqgis_plugin.about: Questo plugin disegna Fetch Geografici. E'possibile assegnare lunghezza e angolo minimo di generazione. Vengono inoltre indicate le distanze e le principali direzioni. Una volta lanciato digitare il punto di inserimento con il cursore, compilare le form e al termine tasto destro per concludere la procedura.

pyqgis_plugin.name: MapBiomas Alert Oficial Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin lets you get alert from MapBiomas Project(http://alerta.mapbiomas.org/).
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin lets you get alert from MapBiomas Project(http://alerta.mapbiomas.org/).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Medir distancia entre...
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin para medir la distancia mínima entre dos entidades.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Plugin para medir la distancia mínima entre dos entidades de forma rápida. La medición se efectúa de forma directa sobre la ventana del mapa identificando los elementos, sin la necesidad de crear capas auxiliares o ejecutar geoprocesos. El plugin admite el cálculo de la distancia indistintamente del tipo de entidad (entre polígonos, de polígono a línea, entre líneas, etc.).

pyqgis_plugin.name: Geodesic Tools
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS3 plugin containing geodesic tools for rectangular mapping, finding intersection point of a line and a circle, finding intersection point of two lines and displacing a line feature. In addition to these main functionalities the plugin contains tools for data manipulation (e.g. explode polygon to lines or split a line).
pyqgis_plugin.about: Use geodesic tools to perform rectangular mapping or to find out intersection points of two lines or line and circle. Plugin contains also some tools supporting these three main functionalities.

pyqgis_plugin.name: THYRSIS
pyqgis_plugin.description: THYRSIS (Transport HYdrogéologique Rapide Simulé en Insaturé et Saturé) is a plugin to simulate hydrogeological flow and transport of chemicals and radiologic substances in both unsaturated and saturated porous environments.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Flow and transport simulations in unsaturated or saturated porous media.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Lizmap server
pyqgis_plugin.description: Designed only for QGIS server. For QGIS Desktop, install the other plugin called "Lizmap".
pyqgis_plugin.about: With a few clicks, it's possible to publish and share your QGIS projects on the Web via Lizmap Web Client, by 3liz.com. QGIS Server is used in the background so all the symbology is kept. The edition forms in QGIS are also available. Demo : https://demo.lizmap.com and documentation : https://docs.lizmap.com and hosting solutions https://lizmap.com

pyqgis_plugin.name: NextGIS EasyQuery
pyqgis_plugin.description: Visual constructor for simple attribute queries
pyqgis_plugin.about: An alternative for Select features using expression tool. Provides less comprehensive, but more intuitive way to run simple queries. Developed by NextGIS. Any feedback is welcome at https://nextgis.com/contact

pyqgis_plugin.name: Easy Labeling
pyqgis_plugin.description: Create Labeling Points for labeling line sections
pyqgis_plugin.about: Create extra points for labels in a labeling layer. From each point you can draw reference points to render arrows. UI/Messages currently only in German. <a href="https://github.com/felixvons/Easy-Labeling/blob/main/manual/manual.md">Manual here</a>

pyqgis_plugin.name: Easy Right Angle Drawing
pyqgis_plugin.description: Draw two lines with a right angle.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Draw two new lines with right angles by defining a triangle. It is used to draw measuring lines e.g. to measure the distance from building corners to a destination point. UI/Messages currently only in German. <a href="https://github.com/felixvons/Easy-Right-Angle-Drawing/blob/main/manual/manual.md">Manual here</a>

pyqgis_plugin.name: MapTileLoader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Download georeferenced parts of tile map services
pyqgis_plugin.about:
This plugin is a simple tool for downloading parts of popular web map services. Only for non-commercial and educational purposes. WARNING: Works only with Python's Pillow module which has to be installed in QGIS
A brief instruction. 1. Select a web map source you want to clip 2. Set zoom level (the more value - the longer download process will be) 3. Draw a frame on map like a rectangle 4. Set folder to save your image 5. Press download.
In result you will see a georeferenced image cropped to frame. Additionaly you can unset "Add image on load" if you don't want images to be automatically added to current project. You can also save your frames to *.xtnt files and then load them in after closing the widget

pyqgis_plugin.name: Custom News Feed
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin helps you display a newsfeed in QGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This QGIS plugin lets you display a feed of articles containing a title, date, text, image and link. The information to display is managed in a JSON-file, that can be provided locally or via url. Custom News Feed plugin is helpful if you want to distriubte news articles organisation-wide.

pyqgis_plugin.name: SEBCS for QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.description: Module for calculation of energy balance features and vegetation water stress indices
pyqgis_plugin.about: The SEBCS for QGIS is software enabling calculation of energy balance and crop water stress features (heat fluxes, evaporative fraction, Bowen ratio, Omega factor, CWSI etc.) from Landsat satellite data (L5 TM, L7 ETM+, L8 and L9 OLI/TIRS) and also from other devices (e.g. UAV). Calculation procedure uses approach based on Penman-Monteith method, SEBAL method and gradient approach of the energy balance characteristics calculation.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Jakub Brom, University of South Bohemia in Ceske Budejovice, Faculty of Agriculture and Technology

pyqgis_plugin.name: QSCS
pyqgis_plugin.description: A QGIS Plugin to Determine Basin Properties for NRCS Peak Flow Estimation in HEC-HMS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Qscs is a plugin created to estimate the peak design flow used in the design of highway engineering structures with the NRCS method.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Return PyQGIS Algorithm
pyqgis_plugin.description: Zero-click pyQGIS searching and copying
pyqgis_plugin.about: Returns pyQGIS algorithms based on an algorithm name.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Stack Composed
pyqgis_plugin.description: Compute and generate in a parallel process the composed of a raster images stack through assemble and reduce by a statistic
pyqgis_plugin.about: StackComposed is a Qgis plugin processing that compute the stack composed (assemble and reduce) using a statistic to get the final value. The result is an assembled image, with a wrapper extent for all input data, with the pixel values resulting from the statistic for the specific band for all the valid pixels across the time axis (z-axis)

pyqgis_plugin.name: QNSPECT
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS Plugin for NOAA Nonpoint Source Pollution and Erosion Comparison Tool (NSPECT)
pyqgis_plugin.about: QNSPECT is the QGIS implementation of the NOAA Office for Coastal Management's (OCM) previous Nonpoint-Source Pollution and Erosion Comparison Tool (NSPECT). QNSPECT is a screening tool designed to allow users to estimate initial baseline pollution and erosion over an area and then compare how those values would change under a different land-use or management scenario. A user must have GRASS installed in QGIS to be able to use certain modules of the QNSPECT. Information and resources for using QNSPECT can be found on the NOAA Office for Coastal Management Digital Coast <a href="https://coast.noaa.gov/digitalcoast/tools/qnspect.html">QNSPECT Tool Page</a>. See the <a href="https://coast.noaa.gov/data/digitalcoast/pdf/qnspect-technical-guide.pdf">Technical Guide</a> for an overview of the typical QNSPECT workflow and a list of references. See the <a href="https://coast.noaa.gov/digitalcoast/training/qnspect.html">QNSPECT Tutorial</a> for an interactive, self-paced introduction to the features and functionality of QNSPECT.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ArrNorm
pyqgis_plugin.description: Apply the automatic relative radiometric normalization to the target image based on reference image using the IR-MAD algorithm
pyqgis_plugin.about: ArrNorm is a Qgis processing plugin for apply the radiometric normalization to the target image based on reference image using the IR-MAD algorithm to locate invariant/variant pixels for a relative radiometric normalization

pyqgis_plugin.name: Easy Copy and Paste
pyqgis_plugin.description: Easily copy and paste features between QGIS layers
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plug-in copies currently selected features in the map view to a target layer with a single click or Hotkey and commits them to the edit on that layer. It also includes a copy-paste hot-key configuration. It's intended for intensive human moderation of feature data. Originally developed for mapping burnt areas from Object-Based Image Analysis (OBIA) polygons. Author: Tom Lynch (Gaia Resources), Charles Darwin University, North Australia & Rangelands Fire Information.

pyqgis_plugin.name: FooODK
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin is developed and maintained to assist ODK Central user to plot Spatial(Points, Lines & Polygons) data in Quantum Geographic Information System (QGIS).
pyqgis_plugin.about: Pulls data from ODK Central to QGIS, using its REST API based on OData.

pyqgis_plugin.name: RoofDraw
pyqgis_plugin.description: This is a QGIS plugin that uses Google Earth Engine sentinel 2 image collection in projection EPSG:4326. the images classified using random forest algoritm and the result tiff is downloaded converted in vector file type shape and open inside current QGIS project.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Develop by: Eixo território do Núcleo de Inteligência Territorial - NIT, Inteligência e Gestão Territorial - IT.DT e Fundação Parque Tecnológico Itaipu – Brasil em parceria com a Itaipu. Instructions of how to install required Python libs you can find in: https://gitlab.com/roofdraw/roof_draw/-/blob/main/README.md

pyqgis_plugin.name: Topographic Profile
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin generate a topographic profile from a CSV file.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin, by providing a csv file, generate a topographical elevation profile. The csv must almost contain: peg number, ground levels, progressive distance as well as other optional information

pyqgis_plugin.name: ST_LUCAS Download Manager
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS plugin for accessing harmonized space-time aggregated LUCAS data provided by the ST_LUCAS system.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin provides possibility of retrieving the subsets of LUCAS data based on spatio-temporal and thematic filters provided by the ST_LUCAS system (https://geoforall.fsv.cvut.cz/st_lucas/). Points will be downloaded based on selected spatial, temporal and thematic filters. Downloaded data is stored as GPKG file in defined directory and automaticaly displayed in QGIS with predefined style. Plugin allows browsing photos and performing class aggregation or nomenclature translation.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: CTU GeoForAll Lab (Jaroslav Zeman, Tomas Boucek, Martin Landa)

pyqgis_plugin.name: VDIP
pyqgis_plugin.description: It computes site-specific soil line using NIR-Red band spectral space. Further, it estimates vegetation and drought indices.
pyqgis_plugin.about: It computes site-specific soil line using NIR-Red band spectral space. Further, it estimates vegetation and drought indices that can be used to analyze agricultural land, soil conditions, crop health, etc.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Density Analysis
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin automates the creation of density heatmaps in QGIS with a heatmap explorer to examine the areas of greatest concentrations. It includes H3, geohash, and polygon density map algorithms along with several styling algorithms. It can paste a style onto all selected layers.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin adds six new density heatmap algorithms to QGIS including geohash, H3, and polygon density maps. It adds a vector density heatmap explorer to examine the areas of greatest concentrations. It wraps the QGIS Heatmap algorithm into a new version that automatically styles the layer and allows the user to specify the cell size in various units of measure and not just the units of the layer's CRS. It provides an algorithm to create a raster density map of polygons. It has three processing algorithms to create a gradient style, random style, and raster pseudocolor style so that they can be used in QGIS models. Another tool allows a copied style or a .qml file to be pasted onto all selected layers. The plugin can be extended by installing the H3 library for blazing fast hexagon density maps.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ProcessX
pyqgis_plugin.description: This Plug-In adds a new processing provider to QGIS. It contains a great variety of different processing algorithms.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This Plug-In provides a collection of various processing algorithms for QGIS. For example "Split Lines at Nearest Points by Condition", "Join Attributes by Nearest with Condition", "Create Nested Grid", "Nearest Points To Path", "Conditional Intersection", "Remove Self-Overlapping Portions", "Translate Duplicate Features to Columns", "Count Nearest Features by Category", etc. See Changelog or Readme for a complete list and more details.

pyqgis_plugin.name: JAXA Earth API Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS Plugin for JAXA Earth API, easily get satellite datasets.
pyqgis_plugin.about: QGIS Plugin for JAXA Earth API

pyqgis_plugin.name: Raster Cutter
pyqgis_plugin.description: Export a raster layer as an image. Select extent, reproject, create Worldfile or Lexocad sidecar files.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin allows the user to select a raster layer from his project, set an extent and export the raster data within this extent to a .jpg or .png image file. Additionally, the plugin can create a Worldfile and/or Lexocad sidecar file if desired. The plugin also supports re-projection into other Coordinate Reference Systems.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Canvas Coordinates
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin shows the coordinates of the canvas extent and selected area in WKT and JSON format.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin shows the coordinates of the canvas extent and selected area in WKT and JSON format.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Dissect and dissolve overlaps
pyqgis_plugin.description: Detect, zoom to, dissect and dissolve overlaps in one polygon layer.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Use this plugin to detect if a polygon layer has two or more features (polygons) overlapping each other. In this case, the plugin can dissect the overlaps into separate features and dissolve those features into the neighboring feature, with three options: largest area, smallest area or largest common boundary. Please download and read the Manual, available from homepage. To run the plugin, go to Processing Toolbox and click on "Dissect and dissolve overlaps". To use the "Dissect and dissolve overlaps" plugin, you need to install and enable the "Processing Saga NextGen Provider" plugin, along with the latest SAGA GIS version (9.x): 1 - download the latest version 9.x of SAGA GIS; 2 - unzip the file "saga-9.3.2_x64" or newer and look for the file "saga4qgis"; unzip this file and follow the instructions contained therein; 3 - activate the "Processing Saga NextGen Provider" plugin by going to Settings->Options->Processing->Providers->SAGANG and enable SAGA, and look for the folder where "saga-9.3.2_x64" was unzipped (this folder must be kept).

pyqgis_plugin.name: MultiJoin
pyqgis_plugin.description: Join in a new layer n fields taken from other n layer having the same field
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin generates a new temporary level with all fields from a source level and further n fields taken from other n levels having the same field

pyqgis_plugin.name: Here Route API Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS Plugin for HERE-API
pyqgis_plugin.about: QGIS Plugin for HERE-API

pyqgis_plugin.name: Geodata to ENVI-met
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin lets you export ENVI-met model areas from geodata, run microclimate simulations from QGIS and also enables you to visualize climate model results in QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about:
ENVI-met is a three-dimensional microclimate model designed to simulate the building-surface-plant-air interactions in urban environment Typical areas of application are Architecture, Landscape Architecture, Building Design or Environmental Planing, Science and many more... <br>ENVI-met is a prognostic model based on the fundamental laws of fluid dynamics and thermodynamics. The model includes the simulation of: <ul> <li>Flow around and between buildings <li>Exchange processes at the ground surface and at building walls <li>Building physics <li>Impact of vegetation of the local microclimate <li>Bioclimatology <li>Pollutant dispersion </ul> With ENVI-met, you will be able to simulate the urban microclimate as an interactive system consisting of dozens of dynamic subsystems ranging from atmospheric dynamics, over soil physics, vegetation response down to building indoor climate.
<br>For the official documentation and tutorials, please see the website at <a href="https://envi-met.info/doku.php?id=apps:gis4envi-met">https://envi-met.info</a>. <br>Download a copy of ENVI-met at <a href="https:www.envi-met.com">www.envi-met.com</a>.

pyqgis_plugin.name: QTribu
pyqgis_plugin.description: Geotribu (https://geotribu.fr) content right into QGIS.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Garde le Qontact avec ta Geotribu !

pyqgis_plugin.name: Numerar Lote
pyqgis_plugin.description: GENERATE REAL ESTATE LOT NUMBERING

pyqgis_plugin.name: QMapa GML 2021
pyqgis_plugin.description: Wizualizacja mapy zasadniczej z plików GML obejmujących zbiory danych EGiB, GESUT i BDOT500.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Wtyczka działa na plikach GML sporządzonych zgodnie z modelami danych 2021. Prezentacja kartograficzna obiektów na mapie jest realizowana wg standardów opublikowanych w rozporządzeniu Ministra Rozwoju, Pracy i Technologii z dnia 23 lipca 2021 r. w sprawie bazy danych obiektów topograficznych oraz mapy zasadniczej.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Diachronix
pyqgis_plugin.description: A plugin to segment a river bed into regular blocks for the automatic extraction of active channel width along a segmented reach
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin divides any longitudinal fluvial polygon into regular units to analyse its planimetric evolution over time or its longitudinal pattern. This allows to consistently track over time the evolution of active channels. In order to use this plugin, the SAGA GIS tools should be activated.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Paul Passy (Université Paris Cité), Frédéric Liébault (INRAE), Guillaume Piton (INRAE), Margot Chapuis (Université Côte d'Azur), Gabriel Melun (OFB), Sylvain Théry (CNRS), Judith Nabec, Estelle Stefanini, Damien D-Arras and Fernando Rico-Quintero
pyqgis_plugin.tags: hydrology,river,active channel,fluvial geomorphology,flood plain,active channel width extraction

pyqgis_plugin.name: QTDC
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS Time Data Control (QTDC): A plugin for animating time-tagged data
pyqgis_plugin.about:
QTDC adds an interactive data animation capability to QGIS for vector layers having a time attribute.
The user can interactively control animation and specify the animation time context, specifically: when in time, how much time, and how fast to animate the time-tagged data.
Multiple layers can be animated with QTDC simultaneously.
The UI also provides a histogram representation of data volume over time for each loaded layer.
The histogram doubles as a control for adjusting where in time and how much time to display.
Animation is bi-directional and is controlled either with UI buttons or with mouse gestures on the histogram.
There is also a basic API that exposes a subset of QTDC operations for interaction with other plugins.

pyqgis_plugin.name: TopoTijdreis
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin loads all historic maps from 1815-2020 from topotijdreis.nl into QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: Qgis plugin that allows you to load all TopoTijdreis.nl map layers (1815-2020) into QGIS as a group.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Dynamic Provider Filter Plugin
pyqgis_plugin.description: QGIS plugin to dynamically set provider filters using QGIS variable replacement.
pyqgis_plugin.about: QGIS plugin to dynamically set provider filters using QGIS variable replacement.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Check, Define & Convert CRS
pyqgis_plugin.description: Check, define and convert CRS
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin have 3 functions: check, defined and convert coordinate system. Developed by Green Field, Ltd.

pyqgis_plugin.name: GEO_search
pyqgis_plugin.description: Layer Geo Search
pyqgis_plugin.about: Retrieval of lot number information and its layer information

pyqgis_plugin.name: XPlan-Reader
pyqgis_plugin.description: Import XPlan-GML
pyqgis_plugin.about:
Remark: This plugin loads XPlan-GML. XPlanung is a German standard for spatial planning data, that's why the plugin is only available in German language.
Mit diesem Tool kann eine XPlanGML-Datei in QGIS mit vordefinierter Layerreihenfolge und Styling importiert werden, z.B. - zur Visualisierung - zur Qualitätssicherung - oder auch zum Erstellen eines QGIS-Server-Projektes, etwa um einen WMS eines Flächennutzungsplans zu veröffentlichen.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Maxent Model
pyqgis_plugin.description: Maxent mapping adapter for QGIS. Adaptador de cartografía Maxent para QGIS
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin will help you to adapt your coordinates and environmental variables for file input in Maxent respecting CSV and ASCII file formats and structure during the construction of potential species distribution models (SDM). Este complemento te ayudará a adaptar las coordenadas y variables ambientales de tu cartografía para poder importarla en Maxent, respetando los formatos y estructura de archivos CSV y ASCII durante la construcción de modelos de distribución potencial de especies (SDM).
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Roberto Matellanes (Gis&Beers, processing tools). Patricio Soriano (Geoinnova, plugin development)

pyqgis_plugin.name: STL Generator
pyqgis_plugin.description: Generate STLs for 3D printing

pyqgis_plugin.description: Set CRS of the Project to the UTM Zone of the area.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Set CRS of the Project to the UTM Zone corresponding to the center of the extend of the active layer.

pyqgis_plugin.name: ETL Connector for ODK
pyqgis_plugin.description: Plugin to connect to the ODK (Open Data Kit) for data retrieval.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugIn connects you to your ODK instance using API link and form id and then loads the data to QGIS in shapefile, geopackage or csv.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Nearest with greater value
pyqgis_plugin.description: Get name (or ID) of and distance to the nearest feature with greater value in a certain field of a point layer. Returns point layer with added attributes and a line layer with connecting lines.
pyqgis_plugin.about: For each feature on a vector layer, get name (or ID) of and distance to the nearest neighbour with greater value in a certain field. On line or polygon layers, distance is calculated between the center points of the bounding boxes. Since version 2.0, distance is calculated on the WGS84 ellipsoid (not on the layer plane) by default. The main output is a layer with added attributes neargtdist (distance), neargtdelta (difference in value), neargtname (name or ID), neargtcount. Note that the features are sorted from lowest to greatest value of the field that was used to compare values. The field neargtcount gives the value of incoming connecting lines linking to points with smaller value. Also returns a lines layer with connecting lines, as well as basic statistics of the distances and deltas (min, max, mean, quantiles). Use cases: Which is the next larger city? How far is the next higher building? Which is the closest peak with higher elevation? Useful for spatial analysis or to categorize features in order to apply different styles (e.g. major and minor summits).

pyqgis_plugin.name: SecQuery
pyqgis_plugin.description: Render geodesic buffers with 4-32 sectors and query the point data in them.
pyqgis_plugin.about: SecQuery is a tool for rendering geodesic buffers with a specified number of sectors. Buffer radius can be specified in cm, m, km, in, ft, mi, nmi or yd. The number of sectors and smoothness of buffer can be configured via user input. The tool also provides the functionality of displaying 16 directional labels. The center point of the buffer can be entered manually or selected from the canvas. The buffer, sectors and direction labels are added as Memory Layers. A Point Layer and a CRS for this Layer are taken as input. The data in a sector can be queried with a map tool which identifies a sector from mouse click coordinates. The queried data is added as a Memory Layer with Point data of selected sector.The attribute table for these layers are displayed.

pyqgis_plugin.name: PEC_Avalia
pyqgis_plugin.description: Realiza a avaliação da acurácia posicional em produtos e dados cartográficos, a partir de normas e padrões brasileiros
pyqgis_plugin.about: Este plugin possibilita executar a avaliação da acurácia posicional em produtos e dados cartográficos a partir de três normas/padrões brasileiros: (i) Decreto nº 89.817 / ET-CQDG; (ii) NBR 13.133, versão 1994; (iii) norma de execução nº 02 de 2018 do INCRA. Para sua aplicação é necessário dispor de uma camada vetorial de teste (produto avaliado) e uma camada vetorial dos dados de referência. Ao executar o processo, o plugin gera um arquivo .txt com o relatorio do processamento e a classificação de acordo com a norma utilizada.
pyqgis_plugin.author_name: Isaac Antunes Miranda Junior; Afonso de Paula dos Santos
pyqgis_plugin.tags: analysis,brasil,standard,spatial data quality,controle de qualidade cartográfica,positional accuracy,acurácia posicional,brazil,cartografia,incra,ufv,pec,qualidade,decreto 89817,et-cqdg,nbr 13133,pec-pcd

pyqgis_plugin.name: UAV Mapping Path Generator (for Litchi)
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin provides a Litchi-compatible UAV flight path for mapping missions, based on an input polygon and drone camera parameters. The output is a .csv file that can be uploaded to the FlyLitchi Mission hub to quickly create a set of waypoints.
pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin prepares a drone flight path based on certain required inputs. This plugin gives a Fly Litchi compatible csv file with way points for the drone path.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Sentinel-5p data explorer
pyqgis_plugin.description: Sentinel-5p data explorer manage NC files from satellite "Sentinel-5p".
pyqgis_plugin.about: NC files are a widespread format, which is used on remote sensing for saving climate and geospatial data in multi-dimensions. "Sentinel-5P" is a satellite which performs atmospheric measurements and saves them on NC files. But NC files are difficult to use, because to working with NC files it is needed to apply programming languages. The aim of this plugin is to open NC files from satellite "Sentinel-5P", in an easy and fast manner, eliminating the need for programming knowledge. Easy to use, it shows the variables, for each NC file that you choose and gives you the option to either export it to a simple text file or to map it on QGIS as a delimited text layer. This way you can visualize the satellite’s data and make high quality maps with QGIS, faster than any programming solution. --WARNING-- Before the installation, make sure that the python library "netCDF4" is already installed in QGIS. To check it, open the "OSGeo4W Shell" and write the command: pip install netCDF4

pyqgis_plugin.about: This plugin provides wrappers for RichDem - fast terrain analysis tools and was initially developed for the course Land Degradation and Development by Wageningen University to provide an alternative for SAGA. IT REQUIRES RICHDEM AND WILL TRY TO INSTALL IT IF NOT FOUND. https://landscapearchaeology.org/2018/installing-python-packages-in-qgis-3-for-windows/

pyqgis_plugin.name: Nearest Neighbor Method for Linear Features (NNMLF)
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin estimates the spatial distribution pattern of linear features.
pyqgis_plugin.about: Named Nearest Neighbor Method for Linear Features (NNMLF), as the convenient name, this plugin uses a method based on modifying the Nearest Neighbor Method for points. In this method, the Hausdorff Distance is used to obtain a measure of the distance between the lines and, thus, infer about the spatial distribution pattern.
pyqgis_plugin.tags: brasil,spatial data quality,linear feature,controle de qualidade cartográfica,positional accuracy,acurácia posicional,brazil,cartografia,ufv,qualidade,nearest neighbor method,spatial distribution pattern,nnmlf

pyqgis_plugin.about: Generate geometry input files for the GMSH mesh generator (http://geuz.org/gmsh) and convert the GMSH mesh file to shapefiles that can be imported into QGIS. The nightly snaphshot(http://geuz.org/gmsh/#Download) version of GMSH is required to mesh the generated .geo files. For more details, see this tutorial : https://github.com/jonathanlambrechts/qgis-gmsh/wiki.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Download data from IBGE
pyqgis_plugin.description: This plugin downloads data from IBGE

pyqgis_plugin.name: Create points on arcs' intersection
pyqgis_plugin.description: The plugin creates a new layer with points on arcs' intersection within the same layer
pyqgis_plugin.about: The plugin creates a new layer with points on arcs' intersection within the same layer.</br>It works in similar way to Line intersections... QGIS function - when you choose the same arcs' layer. This plugin works in an extended way. You can create points on arcs' intersection:</br>1) by first or last node of a source feature with first or last node of another arc;</br>2) by first or last node of a source feature with a body of another arc;</br>3) on intersection between bodies of different arcs;</br>4) on self-intersection of the same arc.</br></br>Apart from that, you can choose the number of intersections between arcs, to create a point.

pyqgis_plugin.name: Deepness: Deep Neural Remote Sensing
pyqgis_plugin.description: Inference of deep neural network models (ONNX) for segmentation, detection and regression
pyqgis_plugin.about: Deepness plugin allows to easily perform segmentation, detection and regression on raster ortophotos with custom ONNX Neural Network models, bringing the power of deep learning to casual users. Features highlights: - processing any raster layer (custom ortophoto from file or layers from online providers, e.g Google Satellite) - limiting processing range to predefined area (visible part or area defined by vector layer polygons) - common types of models are supported: segmentation, regression, detection - integration with layers (both for input data and model output layers). Once an output layer is created, it can be saved as a file manually - model ZOO under development (planes detection on Bing Aerial, Corn field damage, Oil Storage tanks detection, cars detection, ...) - training data Export Tool - exporting raster and mask as small tiles - parametrization of the processing for advanced users (spatial resolution, overlap, postprocessing) Plugin requires external python packages to be installed. After the first plugin startup, a Dialog will show, to assist in this process. Please visit plugin the documentation for details.
pyqgis_plugin.tags: analysis,classification,remote sensing,regression,supervised classification,machine learning,segmentation,deep learning,neural network,onnx,deepness,detection

pyqgis_plugin.about:
FI: Tieosoitetyökalu mahdollistaa monipuoliset hakutoiminnot tie- ja katuosoitteella. Saat tieosoitteen sekä muita tien ominaisuuksia näkyviin helposti karttaa klikkaamalla. Tieosoitevälin ajoratojen osoitetiedot saa talletettua tiedostona taulukkolaskentaohjelmiin viemiseksi.
EN: With Tieosoitetyökalu or Road address tool you can perform different kind of searches with road and street addresses. This plugin displays road addresses and other address properties after a click on a canvas. You can also examine road parts, highlight roadways between two chosen points and search locations by coordinates. Address information of the highlighted roadway lines can be downloaded in a CSV file that is spreadsheet-friendly.

This file than automatically can be uploaded to a webserver using a SFTP connection. Usually the JSON config file then is used by a web viewer to show a layer switcher.
